author: Tony Liebert
title: Gophers men's hockey announces sellout for series against Notre Dame
text:
Gophers men's hockey announces sellout for series against Notre Dame
Gophers men's hockey plays their first Big Ten series at home since December this weekend against Notre Dame. The two-game series will be played in front of a sold-out crowd according to a post on X from the program Thursday.
The 'sellout' does not include the secondary market and it's only based on the tickets sold by the school, so it's worth taking with a grain of salt. Nevertheless, it will be a big series for the Gophers against an ailing Notre Dame squad.
Minnesota returned from its winter break with a series sweep over Mercyhurst at home, but it was a different story last weekend on the road against Ohio State. Following their biggest loss of the season, the Gophers responded with a 6-1 win on Saturday night. They will look to keep the momentum going this weekend against the Fighting Irish.
Notre Dame is 7-14-1 this season and Minnesota accounts for two of those losses, which came 6-3 and 5-3 in a series in South Bend, Ind. earlier this season in November. Despite an up-and-down season, the Fighting Irish still rank No. 38 in the latest Men's Division I PairWise Rankings.
The Gophers are in a tight race with Michigan State for the Big Ten regular season championship, currently trailing by one point in the conference standings. With a series in East Lansing, Mich. looming next weekend, they cannot trip up this weekend against the Fighting Irish.
Postseason play is right around the corner with only six series remaining for the men's hockey team this season. 3M Arena at Mariucci should be rocking once again this weekend, as the students make their way back to campus for the spring semester, which starts on Monday.
Stay up to date on all things Gophers by bookmarkingÂ Minnesota Gophers On SI, subscribing to ourÂ YouTubeÂ Channel, and signing up to receive our freeÂ Gophers newsletter, which will enter you into a drawing for the EA College Gameday 25 video game (you choose between PS5 or Xbox).

author: Elio Henríquez, corresponsal
title: La Jornada - CNTE Chiapas bloquea carreteras; piden justicia para el padre Marcelo
text:
San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Chis. Decenas de maestros del Nivel de Educación Indígena (NEI) de la Sección 7 del Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores de la Educación (SNTE), adheridos a la Coordinadora Nacional de Trabajadores de la Educación (CNTE), bloquearon este jueves la carretera de cuota San Cristóbal-Tuxtla Gutiérrez, para exigir justicia por el asesinato del sacerdote Marcelo Pérez y para que las autoridades educativas den respuesta a sus demandas laborales.
“Estamos aquí para denunciar le artero asesinato del padre Marcelo Pérez Pérez, ocurrido el domingo 20 en San Cristóbal, y sobre todo, para exigir que se haga justicia”, dijo Alfonso López Entzín, coordinador suplente de la Coordinadora Regional de los Altos de Chiapas, NEI.
El dirigente recordó que el presbítero tsotsil originario de San Andrés Larráinzar, apoyó la lucha de los maestros de la CNTE, principalmente cuando el gobierno federal impuso la reforma educativa. “Ha sido un símbolo de lucha y resistencia en favor de los oprimidos; ejemplo de dignidad y entrega en la defensa de los pueblos y por la construcción de una paz verdadera”.
López Entzín señaló que también cerraron a la carretera a partir de las 10 de la mañana para manifestar su rechazo a la pretensión de las autoridades educativas de dividir la jefatura de zonas 710 “para oxigenar a Rafael Entzín Gómez, personaje que lejos de organizar y coordinar la región sólo se ha servido para sus intereses”.
En rueda de prensa, agregó: “Sabemos que es un personaje que sólo se sirve beneficiando a sus familiares y allegados. Por eso hay un enérgico rechazo a la división de la jefatura de zonas 710”, con sede en San Cristóbal.
Manifestó que otras de sus demandas son la contratación de maestros para atender a niños en diversos municipios de los Altos y el pago a profesores interinos que sólo han recibido el salario de tres meses cuando les deben tres períodos, así como la construcción de espacios educativos.
“Bloqueamos la carretera para demandar atención, ya que en cuatro ocasiones hemos sido engañados por las autoridades educativas estatales que no han resueltos nuestras demandas”, afirmó el dirigente magisterial.
 “Por tanto engaño es que optamos por subir la intensidad a la movilización y si las autoridades educativas no resuelven nuestras exigencias, el bloqueo se hará jueves y viernes”.

author: 作者
title: 美国惊现触手兔子，专家警告远离
text:
近日，越来越多的人在美国科罗拉多州发现触手兔子。据报道，这种兔子的的脸上长出黑色的触手状赘生物，而且出现率正在上升。当地居民称，自己在前一年冬天就发现了这样的兔子，第二年这只兔子回来了，还长得很大。
专家表示，这是因为兔子感染了棉尾兔乳头瘤病毒（CRPV）所导致的情况，这种病毒会导致赘生物在动物头部或头部附近生长。虽然专家不认为这种病毒会传播给人类或宠物，但是科罗拉多动物和野生动物保护局仍然敦促任何看到这类兔子的人远离它们，不要去碰它们。

专家表示，这是因为兔子感染了棉尾兔乳头瘤病毒（CRPV）所导致的情况，这种病毒会导致赘生物在动物头部或头部附近生长。虽然专家不认为这种病毒会传播给人类或宠物，但是科罗拉多动物和野生动物保护局仍然敦促任何看到这类兔子的人远离它们，不要去碰它们。

author: time news
title: The curious reason why it is better to breathe through the nose when temperatures drop
text:
2023-12-29 08:00:00
In the middle of winter in Spain, the Ministry of Health has launched the National Plan for Preventive Actions due to Low Temperatures 2023-2024. Among the many recommendations and strategies that it develops, it proposes one that, not out of curiosity, is less effective, because it recommends breathing through the nose now that the cold is intense, instead of through the mouth.
Although we must be especially careful with extreme cold due to the risk of hypothermia and frostbite, drops in temperatures can also negatively affect our health, because they reduce our defenses and favor certain respiratory diseases, such as colds, flu or pneumonia; The cold aggravates chronic diseases, such as heart and respiratory diseases. In addition to the chronically ill, older people and children are also especially vulnerable.
Breathe through the nose, recommended against the cold
When it’s cold it’s better to breathe through your nose.Freepik
The air is warmed as it passes through the nasal passages and thus reduces the cold that reaches the lungs. This is established by the Ministry of Health and that is why it recommends that, given the drop in temperatures, it is a good idea to avoid breathing through the mouth. This recommendation is for cold times, but the truth is that nasal breathing is recommended at all times because the nasal structure offers certain advantages.
For example, it filters impurities thanks to its mucosa, which prevents impurities, such as dust, germs or certain pathogens, from entering our body when we breathe. This is a protection that we do not have when we breathe through our mouth. If the air we breathe is hot and dry, it is moistened as it passes through the nostrils, which prevents the vocal cords from drying out; If the air is cold, it warms up, which prevents the change in temperatures from being noticeable. Breathing through the nose increases oxygen levels in the blood.
In addition to remembering to breathe through the nose, in cold weather it is also advisable to take certain precautions, such as limiting outdoor activities and always doing them with caution, paying special attention to the possibility of ice patches that could cause falls. It is also important to protect yourself from humidity and cold, covering your neck, hands and head, and using several light layers rather than just one thicker one, because they form insulating air chambers between them.
Consequences of breathing through the mouth
It is recommended to breathe through your nose in the cold.©[Zac Ong] via Unspalsh.com.
Breathing through the mouth instead of through the nose can be considered a bad habit, but it also has certain consequences that should be taken into consideration, especially in the case of children. It eliminates the protection that breathing through the nose provides, the air is neither filtered nor heated, it passes directly to the lungs, increasing the risk of respiratory infections and allergies. It can also contribute to chronic health problems such as hoarseness, asthma, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
Finding the cause can help to remedy it because otherwise it can cause alterations that affect the jaw, teeth or the shape of the face. Some people breathe through their mouths because of nasal obstruction, such as when there is a deviated septum, or when they have allergies, asthma, or nasal polyps. Also in people who have become accustomed to it due to constantly suffering from infections, as happens in the case of children.
This is usually a habit that occurs during childhood, which makes the repercussions greater, because the bones in the area will not develop adequately, nor will the muscles inside the mouth and this can cause the child to not develop properly. I can close my mouth. This can cause increased evaporation and decreased saliva production, leading to bad breath and dry lips and, over time, cavities and gingivitis. It can also affect pronunciation.
In general, it is advisable to avoid breathing through the mouth, except when doing intense exercise, when we need extra oxygen, or when speaking, when inspiration is joint.
References
Ministry of Health – Citizens – General recommendations for protection and prevention against low temperatures. (sf).
https://www.sanidad.gob.es/ciudadanos/saludAmbLaboral/planBajasTemp/2023-2024/Recomendaciones_generales_bajas_temperaturas.htm

author: BNN Correspondents
title: Revolutionizing Space Exploration: Merida Aerospace's Perovskite Solar Cells
text:
In an epoch where technological advancements are not just achievements but necessities, the quest for more efficient, cost-effective means to power our extraterrestrial endeavors has taken a significant leap. Merida Aerospace, a US-based innovator in the aerospace sector, is steering this leap towards a sustainable future with the development of perovskite solar cells for low-Earth-orbit satellites. This groundbreaking technology promises to outshine the traditional gallium arsenide solar panels, setting a new standard in the satellite industry.
The Dawn of a New Era in Satellite Technology
The heart of Merida Aerospace's innovation lies in its use of perovskite technology. Unlike the conventional gallium arsenide cells, perovskite cells offer a beacon of hope for a more economical and supply chain-friendly option. These cells, known for their easier manufacturing process, have shown potential for comparable or even higher efficiency levels. Their durability against high-energy radiation in space conditions further positions perovskite technology as a potential game-changer in not only the aerospace industry but also for various applications back on Earth, potentially redefining the solar industry landscape.
Engineering Breakthroughs
At the core of this technological marvel is an inverse opal structure of SnO2 with a honeycomb morphology, serving as the framework for the attached perovskite materials. By meticulously controlling spinning parameters, the team has managed to apply layers with varying pore sizes onto a dense electron transport layer in direct contact with the perovskite layer. This innovation has led to a significant increase in light absorption and surface area. The power conversion efficiency of the MAPbI3 perovskite solar cells exhibited a relative enhancement of 55%, showcasing not only enhanced efficiency but also promising endurance under conventional atmospheric conditions after 1440 hours of aging.
Further advancements were made by investigating polymer-assisted fabrication methods, achieving a power conversion efficiency of 24% by employing polymer-capped SnO2 nanoparticles as the electron transporting layer. Moreover, a novel buried interface engineering strategy using specific molecules optimized air-processed inverted formamidinium lead iodide perovskite solar cells. This strategy not only improved crystallization processes and device stability but also increased the power conversion efficiency from 11.37% to 18.45%. The modified device also demonstrated better carrier extraction efficiency and improved energy levels at the interface.
Future Implications and Stability
Merida Aerospace didn't stop at efficiency; they also tackled the challenge of longevity and stability. Through the development of a novel buried interface modification strategy using DFCHY to improve the performance of NiOx-based perovskite solar cells, they achieved a champion power conversion efficiency (PCE) of 17.08% with outstanding long-term stability, maintaining over 90% of the initial efficiency after 1000 hours of storage in a nitrogen-filled glovebox. This breakthrough not only proves the viability of perovskite solar cells for space applications but also underscores the potential for their use in various terrestrial applications, heralding a new era of energy technology.
In the grand tapestry of technological advancements, Merida Aerospace is weaving a future where space missions are powered by more efficient, cost-effective, and durable solar cells. The development of perovskite solar cells for low-Earth-orbit satellites is not just a step forward in satellite technology; it's a giant leap for mankind's sustainable presence in space and on Earth. With this innovation, we stand on the brink of a new chapter in the exploration of the cosmos, powered by the brilliance of human ingenuity and the relentless pursuit of sustainability.
